{{Open doors}} |attack1=28 ({{Hit type}}: {{Plain flavour}}) |attack2= |attack3= |attack4= |hit_dice=10 |base_hp=5 |extra_hp=6 |fixed_hp=0 |intelligence={{Normal intelligence}} |genus=dwarf |species=deep dwarf }} {{Flavour|A deep dwarf warrior-priest of Yredelemnul that chants unholy homages to the dark god and calls forth the dead.}} ==Useful Info== '''Deep dwarf death knights''' are devout followers of [[Yredelemnul]], using his abilities to siphon away your [[HP]], raise the dead, and reflect your attacks back on you. Like all deep dwarves, they do not regenerate health naturally. They are occasionally found accompanied by a pack of undead allies in [[the Crypt]]. ==Spells== {{Spellcaster |number= |slot1=''none'' |slot2=[[Animate Dead]] |slot3=[[Injury Mirror]] |slot4=''none'' |slot5=[[Drain Life]] |slot6=[[Drain Life]] }} {{clear}} ==Tips & Tricks== *Their tendency to raise dead units as zombies can prolong fights. If there are raisable corpses around (in the Crypt, this likely means those of [[unique]]s), prioritize death knights. *Their Mirror Damage can be deadly: ''don't attack them while Mirror Damage is up.'' Be very careful when using area-of-effect spells when they are around, particularly extremely powerful ones such as [[Fire Storm|Fire]] or [[Ice Storm]]. It is a good idea, particularly if you are using console, to check them using '''x''' to be sure that they aren't mirroring damage. ==History== In [[0.15]], Deep dwarf death knights were replaced by human [[death knight]]s.
